intro: Androcalva cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Androcalva cuneata is an annual herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
